page.title: 05HORSHAM SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The{old Sewage Works}near Broadbridge Farm were built in{1925. {10 people}were employed there to control the flow of sewage which was approximately{8,000 cubic metres}a day. These works had to be closed in {January 1978}due to the large {increase in population}and a high risk of{pollution}to the nearby river. {31,000 people}were connected to it. It is now used as a pumping station for the treated sewage which has been cleansed at the new treatment works. The{new}Sewage Works took three years to construct and is made of steel and concrete. Only{two people are based there now. The flow through the works is{14,000 cubic metres}a day and approximately{40,000 people connected to these works.
